section.title: Overview
section.p: XPontus is a free java based XML editor designed towards text editing. It aims to provide a free alternative to commercial XML Editors.

As XPontus is written in Java it is available for all java enabled operating systems. It has been reported to run correctly on Linux, Windows, Mac OS X, Solaris and FreeBSD. There are many installers for platform convenience.
The software is distributed under the GNU GPL License.

section.title: Why, When XPontus?
section.p: 2 years ago i was looking for a free XML Editor. I discovered a commercial XML Editor called Oxygen XML which wasn't that popular and I liked it. Good and intuitive commercial XML editors are rather expensive. Typically when you buy an XML Editor, you pay for the support and the maintenance packs every year.
I decided to create a free XML editor as I work a lot with XML related technologies.

section.title: The programming language choice
section.p: One of the main design goal was to make the software available to many platforms, so I choose java. I also work as a programmer analyst and java is the primary development language.
It could have been written in any object oriented language easily.

section.title: How i decided to design XPontus XML Editor architecture, to code ...
section.p: I needed to use a kind of MVC architecture to maintain easily the application. I use Spring as object container which configures actions, toolbar and the menubar from a XML file.
Data bindings and user settings storage are easier to deal with when using XStream and JGoodies bindings.
I followed some patterns such as singleton pattern, observer pattern,etc.
I am using Netbeans to code most of the gui because it doesn't really affect the code performance. When i first started i was using a kind of notepad but it was taking me too much time to type :-)
